We are going to combine the three Python programs into a single C program without any I/O in the intermediate steps.

 Steps:
 1. The first program reads an integer `n`, then for `n` lines, reads a list of integers per line and counts the number of lines where the sum of the list is > 1.

 2. The second program reads a string `S` and checks if it has exactly two distinct characters and each character appears exactly twice. If not, prints "No", else "Yes".

 3. The third program reads a string `s`, then splits it into even and odd indices. It then computes two possibilities for making the string alternate (starting with '0' or '1') and prints the minimum number of changes required.

 However, note the sequence: the output of the first program is an integer (c) which is printed and then becomes the input for the second program? But the second program expects a string.

 Implementation details:

        We must read the first integer n, then n lines.

        We'll read the first integer with scanf, then we have to read the rest of the line (the newline) and then each of the n lines.

        We assume that each line is no longer than 1000 characters.

        Steps:

          #include <stdio.h>
          #include <stdlib.h>
          #include <string.h>
          #include <ctype.h>

          int main() {
              int n;
              scanf("%d", &n);
              // consume the newline
              while (getchar() != '\n');   // to consume the rest of the line including the newline

              int c1 = 0;
              for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {
                  char line[1000];
                  fgets(line, sizeof(line), stdin);

                  // Now, split the line by spaces and convert to integers to compute the sum.
                  int sum = 0;
                  char *token = strtok(line, " \n");
                  while (token != NULL) {
                      int num = atoi(token);
                      sum += num;
                      token = strtok(NULL, " \n");
                  }
                  if (sum > 1) {
                      c1++;
                  }
              }

              // Now, convert c1 to a string s1
              char s1[20];
              sprintf(s1, "%d", c1);

              // Now, for the second part: process s1 to get s2 (either "Yes" or "No")
              // We'll compute the frequency of each character in s1.
              int freq[256] = {0};
              int len_s1 = strlen(s1);
              for (int i=0; i<len_s1; i++) {
                  unsigned char c = s1[i];
                  freq[c]++;
              }

              int distinct_count = 0;
              for (int i=0; i<256; i++) {
                  if (freq[i] > 0) {
                      distinct_count++;
                  }
              }

              int valid = 1;
              if (distinct_count != 2) {
                  valid = 0;
              } else {
                  for (int i=0; i<256; i++) {
                      if (freq[i] > 0 && freq[i] != 2) {
                          valid = 0;
                          break;
                      }
                  }
              }

              char s2[4]; // either "Yes" or "No", so we need 3 characters (including null terminator) but "No" is 2, "Yes" is 3 -> so we allocate 4.
              if (valid) {
                  strcpy(s2, "Yes");
              } else {
                  strcpy(s2, "No");
              }

              // Now, third part: process s2 to compute the result.
              int len_s2 = strlen(s2);
              int even_0 = 0, even_1 = 0;
              int odd_0 = 0, odd_1 = 0;

              for (int i=0; i<len_s2; i++) {
                  if (i % 2 == 0) {
                      if (s2[i] == '0') even_0++;
                      else if (s2[i] == '1') even_1++;
                  } else {
                      if (s2[i] == '0') odd_0++;
                      else if (s2[i] == '1') odd_1++;
                  }
              }

              int option1 = len_s2 - (even_0 + odd_1);
              int option2 = len_s2 - (even_1 + odd_0);
              int result = (option1 < option2) ? option1 : option2;

              printf("%d\n", result);

              return 0;
          }
